remarks: If there is a vertex being incident with an edge in a graph, there is exactly one (other) vertex in the graph being adjacent to the given vertex by the given edge, analogous to ~ usgraedgreu .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 4-Jan-2018.)  (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2020.)
statement:
usgedgimp.e $e |- E = ( Edges ` G ) $.
usgedgimp.v $e |- V = ( Vtx ` G ) $.
usgvincvadeu $p |- ( ( G e. USGrph /\ C e. E /\ X e. C ) -> E! y e. V C = { X , y } ) $.
$d C y $.
$d C y $.
$d E y $.
$d E y $.
$d G y $.
$d G y $.
$d V y $.
$d V y $.
$d X y $.
$d X y $.
